title: 104_hr1004
content: Communications Decency Act of 1995 - Amends the Communications Act of 1934 to prohibit the use of any telecommunications device by a person not disclosing his or her identity in order to annoy, abuse, threaten, or harass any person who receives such communication. Prohibits the repeated use of a telecommunications device solely for harassment purposes. Prohibits a person from allowing the use of any telecommunications facility in his or her control for such purposes. Increases: (1) the fine and maximum sentence for such violations. And (2) the fine for the transmission over a cable system of obscene or otherwise unprotected material. Amends the Federal criminal code to: (1) increase the fine for broadcasting obscene, indecent, or profane language over the radio. And (2) include digital communications in a prohibition against the interception and disclosure of various forms of communications. Prohibits a person making a toll-free telephone call from being assessed a charge for the call by being asked to connect or otherwise transfer to a pay-per-call service. Requires a cable operator, in providing video programming unsuitable for children to any subscriber through a cable system, to fully scramble or otherwise block the video and audio portion of each channel carrying such programming to ensure that one not a subscriber to such programming does not receive it. Allows a cable operator to refuse to transmit any portion of a public access program or leased access program which contains obscenity, indecency, or nudity.
